intro: Ornithoglossum vulgare, commonly known as the common ornithoglossum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features striking, showy flowers that resemble bird beaks, giving it its scientific name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, producing clusters of violet to blue-purple blooms. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
